Establishing a mentorship program for productivity: To help manage jealousy, consider establishing a mentorship program where you can learn productivity techniques and strategies from others. This will allow you to identify what works best for you and develop a plan to achieve your goals.

Focusing on your unique strengths: Rather than comparing yourself to others, focus on your unique strengths and skills. Identify what makes you different and use those strengths to set yourself apart. This will help you build confidence and reduce feelings of jealousy.

Practicing gratitude: Practice gratitude by reflecting on the things you are thankful for, such as your skills, abilities, and accomplishments. Focusing on the positive aspects of your life can help shift your mindset and reduce feelings of jealousy.

Setting realistic expectations: Setting realistic expectations can help you avoid feelings of jealousy. Be aware of your limitations and the limitations of others, and set achievable goals that are in line with your abilities.

Embracing failure as a learning opportunity: Rather than fearing failure, embrace it as a learning opportunity. When you fail, take the time to reflect on what went wrong and what you can do differently next time. This will help you grow and improve, reducing feelings of jealousy.
